neal-linnartz.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Initial Board of Directors
neal-linnartz.summary: Appointed the inaugural board of directors for the newly created West End Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone, intended to fund public infrastructure improvements in the western corridor of New Braunfels.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: Final approval rezoning approximately 6 acres along historic Gruene Road from neighborhood commercial and multifamily uses to Resort Commercial district, allowing expanded hospitality development.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (2nd Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: Final approval of a short-term rental special use permit for a residential property on West Faust Street, in a commercial district. Carter voted against at both readings.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: First reading to rezone approximately 6 acres along Gruene Road to Resort Commercial district. The site includes historic Gruene Hall and adjacent hospitality properties.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
neal-linnartz.summary: A proposed short-term rental permit at 1092 State Highway 46 South failed to obtain the required supermajority after neighbor protests triggered Texas's 3/4 council vote threshold.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: First reading to allow a short-term rental at 385 West Faust Street. A motion to deny the request failed 2-5, after which approval passed 5-2.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan Update (Staff Recommendation Version)
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved the city's updated long-range roadway plan as recommended by staff. An alternative motion to exclude Seminole Drive from the plan failed 3-4 in a prior vote the same night.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: City Manager Salary Increase — Robert Camareno (3%)
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved a 3% salary increase for City Manager Robert Camareno following an executive session review, raising his annual compensation to $322,680.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Eminent Domain Authorization — Kohlenberg Road Right-of-Way
neal-linnartz.summary: Authorized use of eminent domain proceedings if needed to acquire a 2.3-acre right-of-way parcel from the Frueholz estate for the Kohlenberg Road improvement project.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: NBEDC Economic Development — The Neue Mixed-Use Development ($2.2M)
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved a $2.2 million economic development expenditure to support The Neue LLC's mixed-use development and public infrastructure improvements in downtown New Braunfels.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 72 Acres Near Kohlenberg Rd / FM 1101 to Light Industrial (1st Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: First reading rezoning approximately 72 acres from agricultural/pre-development to light industrial with airport hazard overlay, to accommodate a Walmart logistics facility project.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Microtransit Services Contract — Via Transportation
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved a contract with River North Transit (subsidiary of Via Transportation) to provide on-demand microtransit services for the New Braunfels Urban Transit District.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Tax Abatement Agreement — Continental Autonomous Mobility (Aumovio)
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved a tax abatement agreement with Aumovio, a self-driving vehicle company, to support the company's establishment in New Braunfels and creation of primary jobs.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
neal-linnartz.summary: Adopted the city's Fiscal Year 2026 annual operating budget and plan of municipal services. The approved property tax rate of $0.408936 per $100 valuation represents a slight decrease from the prior year.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: 2025 Ad Valorem Tax Rate Adoption
neal-linnartz.summary: Set the city's 2025 property tax rate at $0.408936 per $100 assessed value, allocating $0.1939 for debt service and $0.2150 for operations and maintenance.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 846 Ewelling Lane — Multifamily Low-Density (Failed)
neal-linnartz.summary: A proposed rezoning of 0.6 acres on Ewelling Lane to allow additional multifamily housing with alternative design standards failed to achieve the required supermajority after neighbor protests.
neal-linnartz.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-2 (Carter, Capizzi opposed; Edwards absent)

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (1st Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: First reading of an ordinance raising admission fees at Landa Park Aquatic Center and related city recreational facilities. Two council members opposed the increases.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Dry Comal Creek Floodplain Remapping Project ($240K)
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved $240,000 in NBEDC economic development funds to hire Freese and Nichols for a FEMA-compliant remapping of the Dry Comal Creek floodplain, which affects flood insurance rates for area homeowners.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Northeast Side of Old FM 306
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved restricting parking on the northeast side of Old FM 306 between Hunter Road and Common Street to address traffic safety concerns raised by nearby residents.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Denial — Short-Term Rental at 13 & 15 Moss Rock Drive
neal-linnartz.summary: Unanimously denied a request to rezone 0.25 acres on Moss Rock Drive from multifamily to allow a short-term rental special use permit, following a prior postponement from the May 2025 meeting.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: General Obligation and Refunding Bonds Issuance
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved issuance of general obligation bonds in one or more series to finance city capital improvements, including authorization of a paying agent, escrow agreement, and official statement.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
neal-linnartz.summary: Final approval of updated electric utility rates for New Braunfels Utilities for fiscal years 2026 and 2027. Councilmember Carter cast the lone dissenting vote.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
neal-linnartz.summary: Unanimously denied a request to rezone 4 acres on Ervendberg Avenue to resort commercial. The applicant's request for postponement was also denied, and the council voted down the rezoning on the merits.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved postponing a proposed 35-acre multifamily rezoning near FM 1102 and Hunter Road to July 14, 2025. Mayor Linnartz and Councilmember Carter voted against the delay.
neal-linnartz.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
neal-linnartz.summary: A proposed rezoning of 3.5 acres on Krueger Canyon from residential to light industrial failed to obtain the required supermajority after the three newly seated council members voted against it.
neal-linnartz.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved a short-term rental special use permit for a property on Barcelona Drive, despite opposition from three council members including the two newly sworn-in members.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Police Chief Appointment Confirmation — Osbaldo Flores
neal-linnartz.summary: Confirmed the City Manager's appointment of Osbaldo Flores as New Braunfels Chief of Police. Flores was then sworn in by Judge Zamora at the same meeting.

neal-linnartz.itemTitle: Costco Chapter 380 Economic Development Agreement ($1.5M)
neal-linnartz.summary: Approved a Chapter 380 agreement rebating up to $1.5 million of city sales tax revenue generated by a new Costco Wholesale store to incentivize the retailer's establishment in New Braunfels.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Initial Board of Directors
lawrence-spradley.summary: Appointed the inaugural board of directors for the West End Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone to oversee the zone's finances and development projects.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Final approval rezoning approximately 6 acres along historic Gruene Road to Resort Commercial district, allowing expanded hospitality development. Spradley co-sponsored the first reading.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 2 — River Mill Initial Board of Directors
lawrence-spradley.summary: Appointed the inaugural board of directors for Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone No. 2 (River Mill), which will fund public improvements along the Comal River corridor.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
lawrence-spradley.summary: First reading rezoning approximately 6 acres along Gruene Road to Resort Commercial. Spradley seconded the motion, signaling support for expanded development near historic Gruene Hall.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
lawrence-spradley.summary: A proposed short-term rental permit near the airport failed to obtain the required supermajority due to neighbor protests triggering Texas's 3/4 council vote threshold.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
lawrence-spradley.summary: First reading to allow a short-term rental on West Faust Street. A motion to deny failed 2-5 before approval passed 5-2 with Carter and Ryan opposed.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Labowski Alternative Version (Failed)
lawrence-spradley.summary: A motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan with the exception of Seminole Drive failed 3-4. Spradley voted in favor of excluding Seminole Drive from the plan.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Staff Recommendation Version
lawrence-spradley.summary: Final approval of the Thoroughfare Plan as recommended by staff, including all proposed roadways. Spradley voted for the staff version after the alternative motion failed.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: City Manager Salary Increase — Robert Camareno (3%)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Spradley made the motion from the dais after executive session to give City Manager Robert Camareno a 3% salary increase, bringing his annual pay to $322,680.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Eminent Domain Authorization — Kohlenberg Road Right-of-Way
lawrence-spradley.summary: Authorized use of eminent domain proceedings if needed to acquire a 2.3-acre tract from the Frueholz estate for Kohlenberg Road improvements.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: NBEDC Economic Development — The Neue Mixed-Use Development ($2.2M)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved $2.2 million to support The Neue LLC's mixed-use development and public infrastructure in downtown New Braunfels. Spradley seconded Labowski's motion.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Microtransit Services Contract — Via Transportation
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved a contract with River North Transit (Via Transportation) to provide on-demand microtransit for the New Braunfels Urban Transit District.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Tax Abatement Agreement — Aumovio (Continental Autonomous Mobility)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved a tax abatement for Aumovio, an autonomous vehicle company locating in New Braunfels, as part of an economic development package including a Chapter 380 agreement and NBEDC funding.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Consent — Comal County Water Improvement District Bonds ($5M)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved the city's consent to Comal County Water Improvement District No. 3A issuing up to $5 million in unlimited tax road bonds for water infrastructure projects in the Veramendi area.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
lawrence-spradley.summary: Adopted the city's Fiscal Year 2026 annual operating budget. The approved tax rate of $0.408936 per $100 represents a 0.1% decrease from the prior year.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: 2025 Ad Valorem Tax Rate Adoption
lawrence-spradley.summary: Spradley made the motion to set the 2025 property tax rate at $0.408936 per $100 assessed value. The rate is slightly lower than the no-new-revenue rate.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 846 Ewelling Lane — Multifamily Low-Density (Failed)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Spradley motioned to approve rezoning 0.6 acres on Ewelling Lane for additional multifamily housing, but the measure failed to achieve the required supermajority after two members opposed.
lawrence-spradley.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-2 (Carter, Capizzi opposed; Edwards absent)

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Traffic Calming — Mission Drive Speed Limit Reduced to 25 mph
lawrence-spradley.summary: Spradley motioned to reduce the speed limit to 25 mph on the entirety of Mission Road, adding to staff's traffic calming recommendations in response to resident safety concerns.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Lefko USA Economic Development Incentive ($950K)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved a $950,000 NBEDC economic development incentive for Lefko USA, a manufacturing company establishing a primary-jobs facility in New Braunfels.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Dry Comal Creek Floodplain Remapping Project ($240K)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved $240,000 to fund FEMA-compliant remapping of the Dry Comal Creek floodplain, which could reduce flood insurance costs for thousands of New Braunfels homeowners.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: NBEDC — NE Lakeview College Job Training Facility ($3.8M)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved $3.8 million in NBEDC funding for Alamo Colleges' Northeast Lakeview College at New Braunfels to build a primary job training facility and career center.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Denial — Short-Term Rental at 13 & 15 Moss Rock Drive
lawrence-spradley.summary: Spradley motioned to deny a short-term rental permit for a property on Moss Rock Drive in a multifamily district, citing neighborhood concerns.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Neighborhood Traffic Calming Policy
lawrence-spradley.summary: Approved a new citywide Neighborhood Traffic Calming Policy replacing the existing Speed Hump Policy, providing an updated framework for addressing residential traffic safety requests.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Final approval of NBU electric rate increases for FY2026 and FY2027. Carter cast the lone dissenting vote against the utility rate increases.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
lawrence-spradley.summary: Unanimously denied a request to rezone 4 acres on Ervendberg Avenue to resort commercial. Council also denied the applicant's postponement request before voting down the rezoning.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
lawrence-spradley.summary: Voted to postpone a 35-acre multifamily rezoning near FM 1102 to allow additional community input, over the objections of Mayor Linnartz and Councilmember Carter.
lawrence-spradley.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Election of Mayor Pro Tem
lawrence-spradley.summary: Council elected Lawrence Spradley as Mayor Pro Tem following the swearing-in of newly elected members Carter and Capizzi. Spradley abstained from the vote on his own appointment.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Voted against rezoning 3.5 acres on Krueger Canyon to light industrial. Spradley joined Carter and Labowski in blocking the rezone, preventing the required supermajority.
lawrence-spradley.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
lawrence-spradley.summary: Voted against a short-term rental permit on Barcelona Drive in his first contested vote as a newly confirmed Mayor Pro Tem. The measure passed despite his opposition.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Police Chief Appointment Confirmation — Osbaldo Flores
lawrence-spradley.summary: Confirmed the City Manager's appointment of Osbaldo Flores as Chief of Police for the New Braunfels Police Department.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Costco Chapter 380 Economic Development Agreement ($6.3M)
lawrence-spradley.summary: Spradley motioned to approve a Chapter 380 agreement channeling up to $6.3 million in Comal County Water District sales tax revenues toward the Costco development project over 20 years.

lawrence-spradley.itemTitle: Denial — Telecom Tower at 514 S. Castell Avenue
lawrence-spradley.summary: Council voted to deny a rezoning request for a telecommunications tower at 514 S. Castell Avenue, citing concerns about proximity to residents.

toni-carter.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Initial Board of Directors
toni-carter.summary: Voted against appointing the initial board for the West End TIRZ, continuing her pattern of opposition to West End development incentive vehicles.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Voted against the final approval to rezone approximately 6 acres along historic Gruene Road to Resort Commercial district, opposing the development-focused change for the second time.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (2nd Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Voted against final approval of the short-term rental permit on West Faust Street. Carter was the only opposition in the final vote, despite joining Ryan in opposing the first reading.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Voted against the first reading to rezone Gruene Road to Resort Commercial, expressing reservations about the scale and character of development for the historic Gruene district.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
toni-carter.summary: Voted against a short-term rental permit near the airport. Together with Ryan's opposition, the 5-2 vote failed to meet the supermajority threshold triggered by neighbor protests.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Carter seconded Ryan's motion to deny this STR permit, which failed 2-5. When the approve motion passed 5-2, Carter maintained her opposition.

toni-carter.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Labowski Alternative Version (Failed)
toni-carter.summary: Voted in favor of a motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan excluding Seminole Drive from the plan, aligning with neighbors' concerns about the proposed road. The motion failed 3-4.

toni-carter.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Staff Recommendation Version
toni-carter.summary: Voted against the final adopted version of the Thoroughfare Plan, which included Seminole Drive as recommended by staff. Carter and Labowski were the sole dissenters.

toni-carter.itemTitle: City Manager Salary Increase — Robert Camareno (3%)
toni-carter.summary: Voted to approve a 3% salary increase for City Manager Robert Camareno, bringing his annual compensation to $322,680.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Eminent Domain Authorization — Kohlenberg Road Right-of-Way
toni-carter.summary: Voted to authorize eminent domain proceedings if needed to acquire right-of-way for Kohlenberg Road improvements, an infrastructure project the city has pursued for several years.

toni-carter.itemTitle: NBEDC Economic Development — The Neue Mixed-Use Development ($2.2M)
toni-carter.summary: Voted in favor of a $2.2 million incentive for The Neue LLC's mixed-use development in downtown New Braunfels.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Fence Ordinance Amendment — Chapter 144 Zoning Regulations
toni-carter.summary: Voted to approve amendments to the city's fence regulations in the zoning code, updating height and placement standards.

toni-carter.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Tax Increment Zone Creation (1st Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Voted to establish Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone No. 5 in the West End corridor, which will capture future tax increment to fund public improvements.

toni-carter.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
toni-carter.summary: Voted to adopt the city's Fiscal Year 2026 annual operating budget and plan of municipal services.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 846 Ewelling Lane — Multifamily Low-Density (Failed)
toni-carter.summary: Voted against rezoning 0.6 acres on Ewelling Lane for multifamily housing with alternative design standards. Carter joined Capizzi in blocking the required supermajority.
toni-carter.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-2 (Carter, Capizzi opposed; Edwards absent)

toni-carter.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (1st Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Was absent for the vote on updating admission fees at Landa Park Aquatic Center and other city recreational facilities. The measure passed 4-2.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Dry Comal Creek Floodplain Remapping Project ($240K)
toni-carter.summary: Voted against approving $240,000 for floodplain remapping, becoming the lone dissenting voice. Mayor Linnartz was absent, so the vote was 5-1.

toni-carter.itemTitle: NBEDC — NE Lakeview College Job Training Facility ($3.8M)
toni-carter.summary: Voted in favor of $3.8 million for Alamo Colleges' NE Lakeview College at New Braunfels to build a job training and career center facility.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Northeast Side of Old FM 306
toni-carter.summary: Carter seconded the motion to restrict parking on Old FM 306, voting in favor of the traffic safety measure.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Denial — Short-Term Rental at 13 & 15 Moss Rock Drive
toni-carter.summary: Voted to deny a short-term rental permit on Moss Rock Drive, supporting the unanimous council decision to reject the rezoning request.

toni-carter.itemTitle: General Obligation and Refunding Bonds Issuance
toni-carter.summary: Was absent for the vote to issue general obligation bonds for city capital improvements.

toni-carter.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
toni-carter.summary: Cast the lone vote against approving NBU electric rate increases for the next two fiscal years, expressing concern about the impact on ratepayers.

toni-carter.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
toni-carter.summary: Voted to deny a request to rezone 4 acres on Ervendberg Avenue to resort commercial. Council also denied the applicant's postponement request before the vote.

toni-carter.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
toni-carter.summary: Voted against postponing the 35-acre FM 1102 multifamily rezoning decision, joining Mayor Linnartz in preferring the matter be decided promptly.
toni-carter.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
toni-carter.summary: In one of her first votes on council, Carter opposed rezoning 3.5 acres to light industrial on Krueger Canyon. Her opposition, combined with Spradley and Labowski, blocked the required supermajority.
toni-carter.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

toni-carter.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
toni-carter.summary: Voted against a short-term rental permit on Barcelona Drive in her first day on council, joining Spradley and Labowski in opposition to the 4-3 approval.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 2 — River Mill Initial Board of Directors
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi motioned to appoint the initial board for Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone No. 2 (River Mill), the zone created to fund public improvements along the Comal River corridor.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion to finally approve the Gruene Road resort commercial rezoning, supporting the project that Carter opposed at both readings.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (2nd Reading)
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion for final approval of the West Faust STR, a change from the first reading where Ryan had also opposed it.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted in favor of first reading to rezone Gruene Road to Resort Commercial, with only Carter opposing the measure.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion to approve an STR permit near the airport, but the 5-2 vote failed to meet the supermajority threshold due to neighbor protests.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted against Ryan and Carter's motion to deny this STR (which failed 2-5), then voted in favor when Edwards moved to approve.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Labowski Alternative Version (Failed)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted against the motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan excluding Seminole Drive, preferring the staff's recommended version of the plan.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Staff Recommendation Version
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi made the motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan as recommended by city staff, including all proposed roadways. The motion passed with only Carter and Labowski opposed.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: City Manager Salary Increase — Robert Camareno (3%)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to approve a 3% raise for City Manager Robert Camareno, bringing his annual compensation to $322,680.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: NBEDC Economic Development — The Neue Mixed-Use Development ($2.2M)
michael-capizzi.summary: Arrived late to this meeting and was absent when the vote on The Neue development was taken.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Microtransit Services Contract — Via Transportation
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to approve the microtransit contract with Via Transportation to launch on-demand transit services in New Braunfels.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Tax Abatement Agreement — Aumovio (Continental Autonomous Mobility)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to approve a tax abatement for the autonomous vehicle company Aumovio, part of a broader incentive package for a primary-jobs employer.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to adopt the city's Fiscal Year 2026 annual operating budget at a slightly reduced tax rate.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: 2025 Ad Valorem Tax Rate Adoption
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion to set the property tax rate at $0.408936 per $100 assessed value, a 0.1% decrease from the prior year.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 846 Ewelling Lane — Multifamily Low-Density (Failed)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted against rezoning 0.6 acres on Ewelling Lane for multifamily housing. Together with Carter's opposition, the measure fell short of the required supermajority.
michael-capizzi.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-2 (Carter, Capizzi opposed; Edwards absent)

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (1st Reading)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted against updating admission fees at Landa Park Aquatic Center and associated recreational facilities, joining Labowski in opposing the increases.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Lefko USA Economic Development Incentive ($950K)
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion to approve $950,000 in NBEDC economic development funding for Lefko USA, a manufacturing company creating primary jobs in New Braunfels.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: NBEDC — NE Lakeview College Job Training Facility ($3.8M)
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion to approve $3.8 million for Alamo Colleges' NE Lakeview College career center and job training facility.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Northeast Side of Old FM 306
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted against restricting parking on Old FM 306, joining Edwards in opposing the parking restriction ordinance.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Arroyo Verde
michael-capizzi.summary: Capizzi seconded the motion to restrict parking on Arroyo Verde, voting in favor of the traffic safety measure that Labowski opposed.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Denial — Short-Term Rental at 13 & 15 Moss Rock Drive
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to deny a short-term rental permit for Moss Rock Drive properties, supporting the unanimous rejection of this previously postponed rezoning request.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: General Obligation and Refunding Bonds Issuance
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to approve issuance of general obligation bonds for city capital improvement projects.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted in favor of NBU electric rate adjustments for FY2026 and FY2027. Carter was the only council member to oppose the rate changes.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted to deny a resort commercial rezoning on Ervendberg Avenue, joining the unanimous council decision to reject the application.

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted in favor of postponing a 35-acre multifamily rezoning near FM 1102 to allow more community engagement, over the objections of Mayor Linnartz and Carter.
michael-capizzi.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted in favor of rezoning 3.5 acres on Krueger Canyon to light industrial in one of his first council votes, but the measure failed to obtain the required supermajority.
michael-capizzi.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

michael-capizzi.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
michael-capizzi.summary: Voted in favor of a short-term rental permit on Barcelona Drive in his first meeting on council, as the measure passed 4-3 with Carter, Spradley, and Labowski opposed.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned for final approval of the Gruene Road resort commercial rezoning. Carter was the sole dissenter at both readings.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (2nd Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned for final approval of the West Faust Street STR permit. Carter was again the sole dissenter at the second reading.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 4 — Zipp Park Initial Board of Directors
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to appoint the initial board for Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone No. 4 at Zipp Park, the city's new multipurpose sports facility.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Chapter 380 Agreement — Early Matters New Braunfels (Early Education)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve a Chapter 380 economic development agreement with Early Matters New Braunfels, an organization focused on early childhood education and workforce development.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve the first reading of the Gruene Road resort commercial rezoning, with only Carter opposing.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve an STR permit at 1092 SH 46 South with conditions, but the measure failed to achieve the supermajority required due to neighbor protests.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 160 E. Klingemann Street (STR)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to deny a short-term rental rezoning request at 160 East Klingemann Street, and the denial passed unanimously.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve the STR permit after a motion to deny it failed 2-5. His motion to approve passed 5-2 with Carter and Ryan opposed.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Labowski Alternative Version (Failed)
lee-edwards.summary: Voted against a motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan excluding Seminole Drive, preferring the staff's full recommended version.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Staff Recommendation Version
lee-edwards.summary: Voted in favor of adopting the Thoroughfare Plan as recommended by city staff. Carter and Labowski were the two dissenters.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Eminent Domain Authorization — Kohlenberg Road Right-of-Way
lee-edwards.summary: Voted to authorize eminent domain proceedings if needed to acquire right-of-way for Kohlenberg Road improvements.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 72 Acres Near Kohlenberg Rd / FM 1101 to Light Industrial (1st Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve a large-scale rezoning of approximately 72 acres to light industrial to accommodate a Walmart logistics facility.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 215 Dittlinger Street (STR)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to deny a short-term rental rezoning request at 215 Dittlinger Street, citing neighbor opposition. The denial passed unanimously.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Capital Excavation Contract — San Antonio / Water Lane Project
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve a joint construction contract between the city and New Braunfels Utilities for the San Antonio Street and Water Lane project, part of the 2023 bond program.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Tax Abatement Agreement — Aumovio (Continental Autonomous Mobility)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve a tax abatement for autonomous vehicle company Aumovio, part of a broader economic development incentive package.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Reinvestment Zone 2024-01 Ordinance Correction
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to amend the ordinance designating Reinvestment Zone No. 2024-01 to correct an error in the property description in Exhibit A.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
lee-edwards.summary: Was absent for the FY 2026 budget adoption and property tax rate votes at this meeting.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Lefko USA Economic Development Incentive ($950K)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve $950,000 in economic development funding for Lefko USA, a manufacturing company bringing primary jobs to New Braunfels.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (1st Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Voted in favor of updating Landa Park Aquatic Center and recreational facility fees, as Capizzi and Labowski voted against.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Dry Comal Creek Floodplain Remapping Project ($240K)
lee-edwards.summary: Voted in favor of the floodplain remapping project. Carter was the sole dissenter, with Mayor Linnartz absent.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Northeast Side of Old FM 306
lee-edwards.summary: Voted against restricting parking on Old FM 306, joining Capizzi in opposing the ordinance. The measure passed 5-2 over their objections.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: General Obligation and Refunding Bonds Issuance
lee-edwards.summary: Was absent for the vote to issue general obligation bonds for city capital projects.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
lee-edwards.summary: Voted in favor of NBU electric rate increases for FY2026 and FY2027. Carter was the only council member to oppose.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve denial of the Ervendberg resort commercial rezoning, which passed unanimously.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to postpone the FM 1102 multifamily rezoning to July 14 to allow additional community input. Linnartz and Carter opposed.
lee-edwards.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve the Krueger Canyon industrial rezoning, but it failed because Carter, Spradley, and Labowski blocked the required supermajority.
lee-edwards.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards seconded the motion to approve the Barcelona Drive STR permit. The 4-3 vote passed with Carter, Spradley, and Labowski opposed.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Police Chief Appointment Confirmation — Osbaldo Flores
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to confirm the City Manager's appointment of Osbaldo Flores as New Braunfels Chief of Police.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Costco Chapter 380 Economic Development Agreement ($1.5M)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve the Chapter 380 agreement rebating up to $1.5 million in city sales tax revenue to incentivize Costco's establishment in New Braunfels.

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Rezone 1280 Saengerhalle Road — Single-Family Residential (Failed)
lee-edwards.summary: Edwards motioned to approve rezoning approximately 60 acres on Saengerhalle Road to single-family small-lot residential, but no other council member seconded the motion and it died.
lee-edwards.outcome: Failed — motion died for lack of second (Spradley absent)

lee-edwards.itemTitle: Denial — Telecom Tower at 514 S. Castell Avenue
lee-edwards.summary: Voted in favor of denying the rezoning request for a telecommunications tower at 514 S. Castell Ave, after neighbors and council members raised concerns about proximity to residential areas.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Initial Board of Directors
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to appoint the West End TIRZ initial board, voting in favor despite her opposition to the Thoroughfare Plan's staff version in December.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted in favor of the final approval for the Gruene Road resort commercial rezoning, with only Carter in opposition.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (2nd Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to approve the West Faust STR permit at the second reading. Carter was the lone dissenter.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted in favor of the first reading for Gruene Road resort commercial rezoning, with only Carter dissenting.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted in favor of the STR permit at 1092 SH 46 S, but the measure failed to achieve the supermajority required after Carter and Ryan opposed it.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded Edwards' motion to approve the West Faust STR permit after a motion to deny failed 2-5.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Labowski Alternative Version (Failed)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski made the motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan with the exception of Seminole Drive, reflecting concerns raised by nearby residents. The motion failed 3-4.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Staff Recommendation Version
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted against the final adopted version of the Thoroughfare Plan, which included Seminole Drive. Labowski and Carter were the only dissenters.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: City Manager Salary Increase — Robert Camareno (3%)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded Spradley's motion to approve a 3% salary increase for City Manager Robert Camareno.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Eminent Domain Authorization — Kohlenberg Road Right-of-Way
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to authorize eminent domain proceedings if needed for Kohlenberg Road right-of-way acquisition.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: NBEDC Economic Development — The Neue Mixed-Use Development ($2.2M)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski made the motion to approve the $2.2 million incentive for The Neue LLC's mixed-use development in downtown New Braunfels.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 72 Acres Near Kohlenberg Rd / FM 1101 to Light Industrial (1st Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to approve the 72-acre industrial rezoning for a Walmart logistics facility.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Tax Increment Zone Creation (1st Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski motioned to establish TIRZ No. 5 in the West End corridor, voting in favor of the new tax increment zone.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Microtransit Services Contract — Via Transportation
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski motioned to approve the microtransit contract with Via Transportation for on-demand transit in New Braunfels.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (2nd Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski motioned to approve the final adoption of updated Landa Park Aquatic Center fees, reversing her earlier opposition to the first reading.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski made the motion to adopt the Fiscal Year 2026 annual operating budget, which passed with unanimous support from the members present.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 846 Ewelling Lane — Multifamily Low-Density (Failed)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to approve the Ewelling Lane multifamily rezoning, but it fell short of the supermajority required due to Carter and Capizzi's opposition.
mary-ann-labowski.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-2 (Carter, Capizzi opposed; Edwards absent)

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (1st Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted against the first reading of updated Landa Park Aquatic fees, joining Capizzi in opposition. The fees were later approved unanimously at the second reading.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: East Bridge Street Right-of-Way Abandonment
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski motioned to approve abandoning a 0.972-acre portion of East Bridge Street right-of-way adjacent to the Comal River, facilitating a private development project.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Dry Comal Creek Floodplain Remapping Project ($240K)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski motioned to approve the $240,000 floodplain remapping project, with only Carter in opposition.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: NBEDC — NE Lakeview College Job Training Facility ($3.8M)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski motioned to approve $3.8 million for the NE Lakeview College career center, which passed unanimously.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Both Sides of Arroyo Verde
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted against restricting parking on Arroyo Verde, the lone dissenting vote on an otherwise unanimous council.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Northeast Side of Old FM 306
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted in favor of restricting parking on Old FM 306, as Capizzi and Edwards were the two dissenters.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Denial — Short-Term Rental at 13 & 15 Moss Rock Drive
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded Spradley's motion to deny the STR permit for the Moss Rock Drive properties.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to approve NBU electric rate increases for FY2026 and FY2027. Carter was the only dissenter.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to deny the postponement request and then the rezoning itself, both of which passed unanimously.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Was absent for the vote on the FM 1102 postponement.
mary-ann-labowski.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted against rezoning 3.5 acres on Krueger Canyon to light industrial, joining Carter and Spradley to block the required supermajority.
mary-ann-labowski.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted against the Barcelona Drive STR permit in one of the first contested votes of the new council composition. The measure passed 4-3 over her objection.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Police Chief Appointment Confirmation — Osbaldo Flores
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to confirm Osbaldo Flores as Chief of Police.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Costco Chapter 380 Economic Development Agreement ($1.5M)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to approve the Chapter 380 agreement with Costco, providing up to $1.5 million in sales tax rebates over 8 years.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Costco Chapter 380 Agreement — Water District Share ($6.3M)
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Labowski seconded the motion to approve the larger Costco incentive agreement channeling Comal County Water District sales taxes toward the development project.

mary-ann-labowski.itemTitle: Denial — Telecom Tower at 514 S. Castell Avenue
mary-ann-labowski.summary: Voted in favor of denying the telecommunications tower rezoning at 514 S. Castell Avenue.

april-ryan.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Initial Board of Directors
april-ryan.summary: Ryan motioned to appoint the initial board for the West End TIRZ, reversing her reluctance from the December 2025 Thoroughfare Plan vote.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (2nd Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of the final Gruene Road resort commercial rezoning, with Carter as the only dissenter.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (2nd Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of the final West Faust STR approval, reversing her opposition from the first reading on January 12.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 830–870 Gruene Road to Resort Commercial C-4A (1st Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of rezoning Gruene Road to Resort Commercial. Carter was the only dissenter.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 1092 SH 46 S — Short-Term Rental SUP (Failed)
april-ryan.summary: Voted against the STR permit at 1092 SH 46 South near the airport, contributing to the failure to achieve the required supermajority with Carter also opposed.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 385 W. Faust Street — Short-Term Rental SUP (1st Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Ryan motioned to deny the West Faust STR permit, and Carter seconded the motion, but it failed 2-5. When Edwards moved to approve, Ryan was in the 5-2 opposition.

april-ryan.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Labowski Alternative Version (Failed)
april-ryan.summary: Voted against the Labowski motion to exclude Seminole Drive from the Thoroughfare Plan, preferring the staff's recommended version.

april-ryan.itemTitle: 2025 Thoroughfare Plan — Staff Recommendation Version
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded the Capizzi motion to adopt the Thoroughfare Plan as recommended by staff. Carter and Labowski were the only dissenters.

april-ryan.itemTitle: City Manager Salary Increase — Robert Camareno (3%)
april-ryan.summary: Voted to approve a 3% salary increase for City Manager Robert Camareno, bringing his annual pay to $322,680.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Eminent Domain Authorization — Kohlenberg Road Right-of-Way
april-ryan.summary: Voted to authorize eminent domain proceedings for Kohlenberg Road right-of-way acquisition.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Multiple Votes — November 10, 2025 Regular Meeting
april-ryan.summary: Was absent for the November 10 meeting, missing votes on the fence ordinance, appraisal district board elections, and other consent items.

april-ryan.itemTitle: TIRZ No. 5 — West End Tax Increment Zone Creation (1st Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded the motion to establish TIRZ No. 5 in the West End corridor.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Microtransit Services Contract — Via Transportation
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded the motion to approve the microtransit contract with Via Transportation.

april-ryan.itemTitle: FY 2026 Annual Operating Budget Adoption
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of adopting the Fiscal Year 2026 operating budget, which passed unanimously among members present.

april-ryan.itemTitle: FY 2026 Property Tax Revenue Ratification
april-ryan.summary: Ryan motioned to ratify the property tax revenue increase reflected in the FY2026 budget, as required by Texas law for any year with more revenue than the no-new-revenue rate.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 846 Ewelling Lane — Multifamily Low-Density (Failed)
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of the Ewelling Lane multifamily rezoning, but it failed to achieve the required supermajority with Carter and Capizzi opposed.
april-ryan.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-2 (Carter, Capizzi opposed; Edwards absent)

april-ryan.itemTitle: Lefko USA Economic Development Incentive ($950K)
april-ryan.summary: Ryan motioned to approve the Enterprise Zone nomination for Lefko USA as part of a broader economic development incentive package.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Landa Park Aquatic Center Admission Fee Increase (1st Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of updated Landa Park Aquatic fees, as Capizzi and Labowski opposed the increases.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Dry Comal Creek Floodplain Remapping Project ($240K)
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded the motion to approve floodplain remapping. Carter was the lone dissenter with Linnartz absent.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Northeast Side of Old FM 306
april-ryan.summary: Ryan made the motion to restrict parking on Old FM 306. Carter seconded. Capizzi and Edwards were the only dissenters.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Parking Restriction — Both Sides of Arroyo Verde
april-ryan.summary: Ryan made the motion to restrict parking on Arroyo Verde, with Labowski as the lone dissenter.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Denial — Short-Term Rental at 13 & 15 Moss Rock Drive
april-ryan.summary: Voted to deny the STR permit for the Moss Rock Drive properties, as the entire council rejected this previously postponed request.

april-ryan.itemTitle: NBU Electric Rate Adjustment FY2026/FY2027 (2nd Reading)
april-ryan.summary: Ryan made the motion to approve NBU electric rate changes for FY2026 and FY2027. Carter was the only dissenter.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Denial — Rezone 1251 Ervendberg Avenue to Resort Commercial
april-ryan.summary: Ryan made both motions: first to deny the applicant's postponement request, then to deny the rezoning itself. Both passed unanimously.

april-ryan.itemTitle: FM 1102 Rezoning — Postponement Vote
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded Edwards' motion to postpone the 35-acre FM 1102 rezoning, voting in favor of the delay over Linnartz and Carter's objections.
april-ryan.outcome: Postponement passed 4-2 (Linnartz, Carter opposed; Labowski absent)

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 556 Krueger Canyon — Light Industrial M-1A (Failed)
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded Edwards' motion to approve the Krueger Canyon industrial rezone, but it failed to reach the required supermajority.
april-ryan.outcome: Failed — supermajority required; 4-3 (Carter, Spradley, Labowski opposed)

april-ryan.itemTitle: Rezone 463 Barcelona Drive — Short-Term Rental SUP
april-ryan.summary: Ryan motioned to approve the Barcelona Drive STR permit, which passed 4-3 with Carter, Spradley, and Labowski in opposition.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Utility System Revenue Refunding Bonds, Series 2025
april-ryan.summary: Ryan seconded the motion to approve issuance of utility system revenue refunding bonds to refinance existing debt at more favorable interest rates.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Police Chief Appointment Confirmation — Osbaldo Flores
april-ryan.summary: Voted to confirm Osbaldo Flores as New Braunfels Chief of Police.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Costco Chapter 380 Economic Development Agreements
april-ryan.summary: Was absent for the meeting at which council approved two Chapter 380 economic development agreements totaling up to $7.8 million in incentives for Costco's establishment in New Braunfels.

april-ryan.itemTitle: Denial — Telecom Tower at 514 S. Castell Avenue
april-ryan.summary: Voted in favor of denying the telecommunications tower rezoning at 514 S. Castell Avenue.
